title: Genre: Poetry
objective: Read Hebrew poetry with attention to parallelism and imagery

required_passages.text: Identify poetic parallelism, imagery, and figurative language that carry the psalm's meaning.

segments.audio_script: This is lesson eight. Focus on poetry: parallelism, meter, and imagery.
Read Psalm 19:1-6 and identify synonymous, antithetic, or synthetic parallels in the poetry.
Hebrew poetry uses parallel lines to develop thought. Recognize metaphors and symbolic language.
Interpret imagery carefullyâ€”ask whether metaphorical or literal reading fits context. Beware modern sentimentalizing.
Key skill: identify type of parallelism and interpret lines in relation to one another.
What is parallelism in Hebrew poetry?
This completes lesson eight. Next lesson covers legal and cultic texts.

vocabulary.definition: Poetic device where lines correspond in meaning or contrast

study_notes: Poetry frequently communicates theological depth through compact imagery; careful attention to line relations is required.
